item.title: Making Make a README
item.description: My side project with the highest gratification-to-effort ratio is a simple website called Make a README (the source is on GitHub). I made it in 2017 on a whim. I was trying to use a third party library that had an anemic README, and it reminded me of all the other frustrating times I’ve run into inadequate documentation and wished that Stripe could write all the software documentation in the world.

item.title: Why do people spend time learning?
item.description: As humans, we have 24 hours a day to spend as we choose: socializing, sleeping, eating, and - sometimes - learning. What convinces people to dedicate hours, days, or even years to the pursuit of learning? Here are some of the most common reasons - learners may exhibit multiple at a time or move between them, but if you are designing experiences to encourage learning you should be intentional about which ones you emphasize.

item.title: Intergalactic.systems - Self-hosted sync
item.description: There are many desktop applications that generate small amounts of data that at present cannot easily be synced or shared across computes without the use of a third party service. Firefox sync, for example, is notoriously hard to get running nicely. In fact, most desktop applications lack third-party syncing functionality all together.

item.title: Control, In Itself, For You
How to hire a software engineer: a panellist's guide to the technical interview
item.description: Many candidates struggle to express their full potential during a technical interview. As the interviewer, your job is to let them shine. You will certainly look out for red flags, and your attention will naturally be drawn to their technical weak spots. But you’ll have to be intentional if you don’t want to overlook talent. Your job in a technical interview: prove that this very candidate is the best fit for the role.
item.author: (Pierre Prinetti)

item.title: The end of Airplane.dev
item.description: I worked at Airplane, an internal tooling startup, for nearly two years. Earlier this year, it was announced that the company was being acquired by Airtable and that the product would be shut down. In this blog post, I want to explain what happened from my perspective as a former employee.
